sentence.Network_en: There are wide variations caused by different academic programme structures.
sentence.Network_cn: 不同的教学项目结构造成了巨大的差异。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. ː from French académique or medieval Latin academicus, from academia (see academy)

entry.tran: 教学的，学业的（尤指学识方面而非实践、技能上的）
entry.def: Academic is used to describe things that relate to the work done in schools, colleges, and universities, especially work which involves studying and reasoning rather than practical or technical skills.

example.ex: I was terrible at school and left with few academic qualifications...
example.tran: 我的学习成绩一塌糊涂，离校时几乎没有学历。

entry.def: Academic is used to describe things that relate to schools, colleges, and universities.

example.ex: ...the start of the last academic year...
I'd had enough of academic life.
example.tran: 学生生活我已经过够了。

entry.tran: 学术的,重研究与思辨的（与重实践或技能相对）
entry.def: Academic is used to describe work, or a school, college, or university, that places emphasis on studying and reasoning rather than on practical or technical skills.

example.ex: The author has settled for a more academic approach...
example.tran: 那位作者已确定采用更为学术的方法。

example.ex: Different schools teach different types of syllabus, from the highly academic to the broadly vocational.
example.tran: 不同的学校有不同的教学计划，从高度学术的到普通职业教育的，不一而足。

entry.def: Someone who is academic is good at studying.

example.ex: The system is failing most disastrously among less academic children.
example.tran: 这种制度对学习不太好的孩子效果最差。

entry.tran: 大学教师；高校科研人员
entry.def: An academic is a member of a university or college who teaches or does research.

entry.tran: 学究式的；空谈的；不切实际的
entry.def: You can say that a discussion or situation is academic if you think it is not important because it has no real effect or cannot happen.

example.ex: This was not an academic exercise — soldiers' lives were at risk...
example.tran: 这不是纸上演习——士兵的生命受到了威胁。

example.ex: Such is the size of the problem that these arguments are purely academic.
example.tran: 问题的实情在于这些论点纯属空谈。

means.word_mean: 1. an educator who works at a college or university
1. associated with academia or an academy;
2. hypothetical or theoretical and not expected to produce an immediate or practical result;
3. marked by a narrow focus on or display of learning especially its trivial aspects

auth_sentence.content: Instead the author trots out the old academic solution.
auth_sentence.res_content: Instead the author trots out the old academic solution.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Instead the author trots out the old academic solution.

auth_sentence.content: Opponents of tenure maintain the academic-freedom argument is overstated.
auth_sentence.res_content: Opponents of tenure maintain the academic-freedom argument is overstated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Opponents of tenure maintain the academic-freedom argument is overstated.

auth_sentence.content: They also have initiated academic programs on environmental issues.
auth_sentence.res_content: They also have initiated academic programs on environmental issues.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They also have initiated academic programs on environmental issues.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表形容词,"……的"; 2. 表名词,"人或科学"; 3. 表名词,"某种药或医学有关"

stems_affixes.word_buile: academy专科院校,研究院+ic……的→academic学院的
ascet练习+ic……的→adj.禁欲的 n.苦行者
elast+ic……的→adj.弹性的
electron电子+ic……的→adj.电子的
fan狂热者+at+ic……的→adj.狂热的,盲信的 n.狂热者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 磁的,有磁性的,有吸引力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: magnet磁体,磁铁+ic……的→adj.磁的,有磁性的,有吸引力的
metr=meter米+ic……的→adj.米制的,公制的
prosa=prose散文+ic……的→像散文一样平淡,无趣
sept感染+ic……的→adj.受感染的,腐败的
stat站+ic……的→站着的,静止的
symmetry[n.对称]+ic……的→symmetric相称性的
vitriol硫酸盐,刻薄话+ic……的→adj.刻薄的,强烈的
geography地理[学]+ic人或科学→geographic地理[学]的
an无+alg痛+es+ic药物→n.镇痛剂 adj.止痛的
psyche灵魂;精神+del看+ic某种药或医学有关→adj.引起幻觉的 n.迷幻药
sopor迷睡,昏睡,酣睡+if+ic某种药或医学有关→adj.催眠的 n.安眠药
ascet练习+ic……的→adj.禁欲的 n.苦行者
fan狂热者+at+ic……的→adj.狂热的,盲信的 n.狂热者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 怀疑论者,无神论者,怀疑宗教的人
stems_affixes.word_buile: skept怀疑+ic人或科学→n.怀疑论者,无神论者,怀疑宗教的人
arith数学+met+ic人或科学→n.算术,四则运算
crit评判,批评+ic人或科学→n.批评家,评论家
log说话,词语,思想+ic人或科学→说话的学问→逻辑学
mim模仿+ic人或科学→v.模仿,戏弄 n.模仿他人言行的人
rhetor修辞学者+ic人或科学→n.修辞学,浮夸的言语
sto+ic人或科学→来自古希腊斯多葛派学,主张以苦为乐
an无+alg痛+es+ic药物→n.镇痛剂 adj.止痛的
an无+esthet感觉+ic某种药或医学有关→n.麻醉剂
cathart净化+ic某种药或医学有关→n.泻药
emet呕吐+ic某种药或医学有关→n.催吐药
psyche灵魂;精神+del看+ic某种药或医学有关→adj.引起幻觉的 n.迷幻药
sopor迷睡,昏睡,酣睡+if+ic某种药或医学有关→adj.催眠的 n.安眠药
mim模仿+ic人或科学→v.模仿,戏弄 n.模仿他人言行的人

Sentence.sentence: The academic value of the courses.
Useful thinking skills for advanced academic research.
Along with the new structure came a more demanding academic program, the percentage of freshmen taking biology jumped from 17 to 95.

sentences.en: The university is composed of five academic schools.
sentences.cn: 整个大学由五个学院组成。

means.word_mean: 纯理论的, 不切实际的

sentences.en: That is merely an academic discussion.
sentences.cn: 那只是一个理论性的讨论。

means.word_mean: 大学教师; 专业学者

sentences.en: Her husband is a famous academic.
sentences.cn: 她的丈夫是一位著名的学者。

jushi.english: The academic year begins in September.
That is merely an academic discussion.
